alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 09 at 1:30PM CDT until April 09 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR OSAGE...PAWNEE...AND CREEK COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 9 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oklahoma, Osage, Pawnee, and Creek counties. * WIND...South at 15 to 20 mph, gusting to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...15 to 20 percent. * TEMPERATURE...Low to mid 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
